title: Quiz 2: Biology & Perception
description: Assess knowledge on genetics, chromosomal abnormalities, sensory thresholds, and perceptual organization.

questions.question: A specific chromosomal abnormality called ___BLANK___ is caused by an extra chromosome on the 21st pair (Trisomy 21), while ___BLANK___ occurs in females who have a missing X chromosome (XO).
questions.explanation: Down Syndrome is Trisomy 21. Turner's Syndrome is a sex chromosome monosomy (XO).
questions.hint: One is associated with the 21st pair, the other affects females only.

questions.question: Which Gestalt principle explains why we tend to fill in gaps to perceive a complete figure?

richContent.content: C _ R C L _

questions.explanation: Closure is the tendency to complete incomplete figures to form meaningful objects.

questions.question: Match the sensory threshold to its definition:

pairs.right: Smallest amount of stimulus needed to notice presence
Converting physical energy into neural impulses

questions.explanation: Absolute = minimum to detect. Difference = minimum change. Adaptation = getting used to it. Transduction = conversion.
questions.hint: Absolute is the baseline; Difference is the change.

questions.question: What is the difference between Genotype and Phenotype?

options.text: Genotype is the physical appearance; Phenotype is the genetic makeup
Genotype is the genetic heritage; Phenotype is the observable characteristics
Genotype comes from the mother; Phenotype comes from the father

questions.explanation: Genotype refers to the actual genetic material (DNA). Phenotype is how it is expressed (height, eye color, intelligence).

questions.question: The image below represents the Muller-Lyer illusion. Which statement accurately describes this illusion?

richContent.caption: Two lines with arrowheads pointing different directions

options.text: The top line is actually longer than the bottom line
The bottom line is actually longer than the top line
Both lines are the same length, but the arrow direction distorts perception
It demonstrates the principle of continuity

questions.explanation: In the Muller-Lyer illusion, lines of equal length appear different due to the inward or outward pointing arrowheads.
questions.hint: Do not trust your eyes; think about the reality of the lines.

questions.question: Perceptual Constancy is the tendency to perceive objects as changing their shape or size whenever the viewing angle or distance changes.
questions.explanation: False. Perceptual Constancy is the tendency to perceive objects as STABLE and UNCHANGING (e.g., a door is still rectangular even when opening) despite changes in sensory input.

questions.question: Which of the following are examples of Perceptual Constancies? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The main constancies are Shape, Size, Brightness, and Color.
questions.hint: Gravity is a physical law, not a perceptual constancy.

questions.question: What is the term for the perceptual phenomenon where a person perceives future events before they happen?
questions.explanation: Precognition is a form of Extrasensory Perception (ESP) involving knowledge of future events.
